title: Military Surplus
text: This project looks at how much U.S. military surplus equipment has been transferred to law enforcement agencies. It uses data from from the “1033 program” handled through the Law Enforcement Support Office, which posts data quarterly.

title: Military Surplus
text:
Summary
Police departments across Central Texas, including Austin and San Marcos, have received millions of dollars in military-grade equipment since 2010, bringing surveillance tools, tactical robots and weapons accessories into local law enforcement.
The Austin Police Department alone received about $2.5 million in controlled equipment, including bomb disposal robots, surveillance robots and hundreds of weapon sights, illuminators and night vision devices. These tools expand the department’s ability to conduct tactical operations and surveillance using equipment originally designed for military use.
Smaller nearby agencies have also received significant transfers. The San Marcos Police Department, which serves a population of about 63,000, received nearly $3.2 million in military equipment, showing how even mid-size departments can obtain large amounts of federal surplus.
Across Texas, law enforcement agencies have received 18,677 controlled items since 2010, reflecting the continued flow of military resources into local policing at both large and small departments.

title: Cleaning
text:
Download the data
Import the data
Check datatypes
Create a total_value variable
Create a control_type variable
Filter the date range (since Jan. 1 2010)
Export the cleaned data

title: Cleaning
text:
Setup
Setting up and adding our libraries.

library(tidyverse)

title: Cleaning
text:
Downloading the data
While the data we will use here if from Prof. McDonald, it is from the Law Enforcement Support Office. Find more information about the program here.

download.file(
  "https://github.com/utdata/rwd-r-leso/blob/main/data-processed/leso.csv?raw=true",
  "data-original/leso.csv",
  mode = "wb"
)

title: Cleaning
text:
Import
Importing the data into our project.

leso_raw <- read_csv("data-original/leso.csv")

Rows: 79761 Columns: 12
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (7): state, agency_name, nsn, item_name, ui, demil_code, station_type
dbl  (4): sheet, quantity, acquisition_value, demil_ic
dttm (1): ship_date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

leso_raw


  




leso_raw |> glimpse()

title: Cleaning
text:
Cleaning and changing columns
Removing the sheet column and adding a total_value column.

leso_tight <- leso_raw |>
  select(!sheet)

leso_tight |> glimpse()

Rows: 79,761
Columns: 11
$ state             <chr> "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL"…
$ agency_name       <chr> "ABBEVILLE POLICE DEPT", "ABBEVILLE POLICE DEPT", "A…
$ nsn               <chr> "1240-01-411-1265", "2540-01-565-4700", "1005-01-587…
$ item_name         <chr> "SIGHT,REFLEX", "BALLISTIC BLANKET KIT", "MOUNT,RIFL…
$ quantity          <dbl> 9, 10, 10, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 6, 1, 1, 1,…
$ ui                <chr> "Each", "Kit", "Each", "Each", "Each", "Each", "Each…
$ acquisition_value <dbl> 339.00, 16568.15, 1626.00, 10000.00, 62627.00, 65800…
$ demil_code        <chr> "Q", "D", "D", "Q", "C", "C", "C", "D", "Q", "Q", "D…
$ demil_ic          <dbl> 3, 1, 1, 3, 1, 1, 1, 1, 3, 3, 1, 1, 1, 3, 1, 1, 1, 3…
$ ship_date         <dttm> 2016-09-14, 2018-01-30, 2016-09-19, 2017-03-28, 201…
$ station_type      <chr> "State", "State", "State", "State", "State", "State"…



leso_total <- leso_tight |>
  mutate(total_value = quantity * acquisition_value)

leso_total |> glimpse()

Checking if it works.

leso_total |> 
  slice_sample(n = 10) |>
  select(agency_name, quantity, acquisition_value, total_value)

title: Cleaning
text:
Controlled data
Categorizing the controlled data.

leso_control <- leso_total |> 
  mutate(
    control_type = case_when(
      str_detect(item_name, "AIRPLANE") ~ TRUE,
      (demil_code == "A" | (demil_code == "Q" & demil_ic == 6)) ~ FALSE,
      .default = TRUE
    )
  )

leso_control |> glimpse()

Rows: 79,761
Columns: 13

$ nsn               <chr> "1240-01-411-1265", "2540-01-565-4700", "1005-01-587…

$ quantity          <dbl> 9, 10, 10, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 6, 1, 1, 1,…

title: Cleaning
text:
Date filter
Filtering data to show dates past 2010.

leso_dated <- leso_control |> 
  filter(
    ship_date >= "2010-01-01"
  )

leso_dated |> summary()

title: Cleaning
text:
Export
Exporting our cleaned and filtered data.

leso_dated |> write_rds("data-processed/01-leso-clean.rds")

title: Texas Analysis
text:
Analyzing controlled military surplus equipment transferred to Texas law enforcement agencies since 2010, including total quantities, values, agency totals and specific items received.

How many total controlled items are in the hands of Texas agencies, and what are they all worth?
How many total controlled items does each agency have and how much is it all worth?
How many total controlled items do local agencies have and what is their total value?
What specific controlled items does each agency have and how much are they worth?
What controlled items did local agencies receive?

title: Texas Analysis
text:
Analyzing controlled military surplus equipment transferred to Texas law enforcement agencies since 2010, including total quantities, values, agency totals and specific items received.

How many total controlled items are in the hands of Texas agencies, and what are they all worth?
How many total controlled items does each agency have and how much is it all worth?
How many total controlled items do local agencies have and what is their total value?
What specific controlled items does each agency have and how much are they worth?
What controlled items did local agencies receive?

title: Texas Analysis
text:
Setup
Setting up and importing libraries

library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)

title: Texas Analysis
text:
Import
Importing the data into the project.

leso <- read_rds("data-processed/01-leso-clean.rds")

leso |> glimpse()

Rows: 54,838
Columns: 13
$ state             <chr> "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL"…
$ agency_name       <chr> "ABBEVILLE POLICE DEPT", "ABBEVILLE POLICE DEPT", "A…
$ nsn               <chr> "1240-01-411-1265", "2540-01-565-4700", "1005-01-587…
$ item_name         <chr> "SIGHT,REFLEX", "BALLISTIC BLANKET KIT", "MOUNT,RIFL…
$ quantity          <dbl> 9, 10, 10, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 1, 1, 6, 1, 3, 3, 2, 1,…
$ ui                <chr> "Each", "Kit", "Each", "Each", "Each", "Each", "Each…
$ acquisition_value <dbl> 339.00, 16568.15, 1626.00, 10000.00, 62627.00, 65800…
$ demil_code        <chr> "Q", "D", "D", "Q", "C", "C", "C", "Q", "Q", "D", "D…
$ demil_ic          <dbl> 3, 1, 1, 3, 1, 1, 1, 3, 3, 1, 1, 3, 1, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3…

$ station_type      <chr> "State", "State", "State", "State", "State", "State"…
$ total_value       <dbl> 3051.00, 165681.50, 16260.00, 10000.00, 62627.00, 65…
$ control_type      <lgl> TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE…

title: Texas Analysis
Texas Analysis
text:
Grabbing controlled items
Filtering to capture the controlled data for analysis.

leso_c <- leso |> 
  filter(control_type == TRUE)

title: Texas Analysis
text:
Texas controlled items
Filtering the controlled items to include only Texas agencies.

leso_c_tx <- leso_c |>
  filter(state == "TX")

leso_c_tx

title: Texas Analysis
text:
Total controlled items in Texas
Summarizing the total quantity and total value of controlled equipment in Texas.

leso_c_tx |>
  summarize(
    summed_quantity = sum(quantity),
    summed_total_value = sum(total_value)
  )


  



Data Takeaway: Texas law enforcement agencies have received 18,677 controlled military surplus items since 2010, with a combined value of about $125 million.

title: Texas Analysis
Texas Analysis
text:
Local agency totals
Filtering the agency totals to include only selected Central Texas law enforcement agencies.

local_agencies <- c(
  "AUSTIN PARKS POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "AUSTIN POLICE DEPT",
  "BASTROP COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE",
  "BASTROP POLICE DEPT",
  "BEE CAVE POLICE DEPT",
  "BUDA POLICE DEPT",
  "CALDWELL COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE",
  "CEDAR PARK POLICE DEPT",
  "ELGIN POLICE DEPARTMENT",
  "FLORENCE POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "GEORGETOWN POLICE DEPT",
  "GRANGER POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "HAYS CO CONSTABLE PRECINCT 4",
  "HAYS COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE",
  "HUTTO POLICE DEPT",
  "JARRELL POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "JONESTOWN POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "KYLE POLICE DEPT",
  "LAGO VISTA POLICE DEPT",
  "LAKEWAY POLICE DEPT",
  "LEANDER POLICE DEPT",
  "LIBERTY HILL POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "LOCKHART POLICE DEPT",
  "LULING POLICE DEPT",
  "MANOR POLICE DEPT",
  "MARTINDALE POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "PFLUGERVILLE POLICE DEPT",
  "ROLLINGWOOD POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "SAN MARCOS POLICE DEPT",
  "SMITHVILLE POLICE DEPT",
  "SUNSET VALLEY POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "TAYLOR POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "THRALL POLICE DEPT", #NI
  # TEXAS STATE UNIVERSITY HI_ED
  "TRAVIS COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE",
  # TRAVIS CONSTABLE OFFICE,
  # SOUTHWESTERN UNIVERSITY HI_ID
  "WESTLAKE HILLS POLICE DEPT", #NI
  "UNIV OF TEXAS SYSTEM POLICE HI_ED",
  "WILLIAMSON COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE"
)

tx_agency_totals |>
  filter(agency_name %in% local_agencies)


  



Among Central Texas agencies, the San Marcos Police Department received the most equipment, valued at nearly $3.2 million. The Austin Police Department follows with approximately $2.5 million.
